parameters.definition: Number of planks of wood a miter saw can cut per day
Number of units of sawdust produced by a miter saw per day
Number of planks of wood a circular saw can cut per day
Number of units of sawdust produced by a circular saw per day
Minimum required number of planks of wood to cut per day
Maximum amount of sawdust that can be produced per day

description: A woodshop can purchase two types of saws, a miter saw and a circular saw. A miter saw can cut \param{MiterPlanks} planks of wood and produces \param{MiterSawdust} units of sawdust per day. A circular saw can cut \param{CircularPlanks} planks of wood and produces \param{CircularSawdust} units of sawdust per day. The woodshop must cut at least \param{MinPlanks} planks of wood per day. However, to avoid too much pollution in the woodshop, they can produce at most \param{MaxSawdust} units of sawdust per day. How many of each type of saw should be purchased to minimize the total number of saws needed?
